intro: Tripterygium wilfordii, commonly known as leech plant or false mandrake, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant contains various bioactive compounds, including tripterygium glycosides, which have been studied for their medicinal properties. It is often cultivated for its medicinal uses in traditional Chinese medicine. However, it is toxic and requires careful handling due to its potent effects.
